Hero.text: {=arI9dpsg}Solarios 'Light-Giver' was born Zenon of the Neretzes clan. A formidable warrior and general in his younger years, a victory over the Gotarnians in battle three years ago saw his troops hail him emperor, shattering the Calradian Empire's eastern provinces and creating a rebel state. Soon after, a failed assassination attempt by his political rivals left Zenon scarred and badly shaken. Taking solace in an obscure eastern religion, he began hallucinating that he was the mortal incarnation of the sun god himself, and so duly named himself Solarios 'Light-Giver'. Since then, he has carved a bloody swathe through his enemies and friends alike, driving himself ever further into madness. Now, his remaining generals support him out of fear, though know that clever politics may just turn their emperor's insanity to their own advantage.

{=arI9dpse}Semnon is the son of Solarios, the rebel general-turned-emperor of the Eastern Empire. Two years ago, he was forced to watch as his mother was executed on his father's insane orders after he observed her gazing at the moon out of their bedroom window one night and believed she was communicating with his mortal enemy: the moon god. Since then, Semnon has become withdrawn, preferring to spend time in camp with his legions than in the halls of imperial power.

{=arI9dpuu}The Calradian Empire is ruled by Helenea, wife of the late-Emperor Themestios and regent for their son Jamanys. The first female ruler of the Calradian Empire since the lady Zeona, two centuries ago, she will rule until her son comes of age. Generous and wise, she is a popular figure with the Empire's people, though has little support amongst those in the senatorial nobility who remain loyal to her family. Whilst they voted for her son, many in the senate worry that Helenea may take the imperial throne for herself, instead of handing over power when Jamanys is at the rightful age.

{=arI9dpuv}Themestios was the last emperor of a united Calradian Empire. A cunning politician and efficient administrator, he successfully led the Empire in campaigns of expansion to the east, incorporating much of the remaining Palaic territory west of Lake Tanaesis into the imperial fold. However, his reign was cut short when a campaign into the Iltan Portages went awry, with the emperor's camp being overrun by Gotarnian horsemen during the night. In the brief battle, Themestios was slain and the dragon banner of Calradios was carried off by Gotarnian tribesmen as a trophy; the emperor's sudden loss leaving the Empire in a state of disarray.

{=arI9dpuw}Junia is the eldest child of the late-Emperor Themestios. A natural-born leader, she spent much of her childhood learning the arts of statecraft from her father and mother, being given the high honor of leading an elite unit of her father's lancers at only the age of 18. Passed over for succession to the imperial throne in favor of her younger brother, Junia now follows her own path.

{=arI9dpux}Jamanys is the heir-apparent for the throne of the Calradian Empire. After the untimely death of his father Themestios, the Calradian senate met to vote on the matter of succession. The late-emperor had named his son as heir, though many senators believed that a boy so young was unfit to rule. A vote was held, with Jamanys being nominated Emperor by an incredibly slim margin. Abandoned immediately by nearly half of the senate, who fled to the west, the remaining senators named Jamanys' mother regent until he comes of age. However, with civil war raging on all sides, some say the Empire may not survive long enough for him to take his throne.

Dorios is the head of the Western Empire. A senator from an old family; his people have raised cattle in the fertile western lands of the Calradian Empire for generations. He is a reluctant ruler, driven to secession from the Empire by the weakness of the Emperors to protect his homeland and estates from the growing Vlandian menace. Now, he leads a senate comprising the most powerful western nobles, attempting to reclaim what was lost to the invaders.

Alexios is the head of clan Pethros; one of the Calradian Empire's oldest and most esteemed noble families. Whilst his ancestors once held the imperial purple, he has little ambition for higher office, instead turning his attentions to serving the imperial family and the people of Lycaron as a diligent administrator. Secretly, he hopes his former colleagues, now serving in the western separatist senate, can be convinced to return peacefully to the imperial fold.

Sivur is the Grand Prince of the Sturgians. Whilst a monarch in his own right, he has no real authority over the other Sturgian principalities, instead being elected from amongst his peers to lead the Sturgian people on the field of battle. A calculating and ruthless authoritarian, he wishes nothing more than to gain effective dominance over the other ruling Sturgian clans, however faces stiff resistence to his centralising actions from the other princes.

{=6lZGNChB}Porev is lord of the Kaldaving, one of the younger houses of the Vaegirians. His people have always been as interested in trade as they have been in war, although Godun himself is everything a boyar might want: cooperative, prompt to pay his feudal dues, quick to respond to his liege's calls to arms. Yet Vidar has never fully trusted him, because it is hard to imagine a Kaldaving without his own long-term plan for personal aggrandizement.

{=AR00031}Kharid is the head of the Banu Hulyan; one of the oldest clans of the Nahasa. Centuries ago, his forefathers settled around the Damar River, trading their nomadic lifestyle for the safety of solid stone walls. Over the years, the Banu Hulyan have maintained a strong grip over the south, crushing smaller clans and occasionally contesting the larger clans for rule of the Aserai. Less than a year ago, Kharid was visited by the prophet Musyaz, hailing from a distant oasis far to the south, who now whispers in his ear that he should lead the Aserai in shaking off their old ways and carving an empire for themselves amongst the shifting sands.

{=AR0aSR5J}The current Shah of the Banu Asera is Aydas, the head of the Banu Atij clan. An ardent traditionalist and cunning politician, he has attempted to quell the constant infighting amongst the clans of the Nahasa, modelling his governance on the ways of the Darshi Padishahs. However, the clans do not respect his rule, with many believing the teachings of a cult centered around a prophet called Musyaz, who claims the Aserai should shake off the old ways of the Darshi conquerers and assert their dominance over the Nahasa.

{=ARiQI7ps}Osric Iron-Arm is the first king of the Vlandians. Raised by his uncle, Osric was brought up on one of the Vlandians' many campaigns in service of the Calradian Empire in the eastern provinces. Taught to distrust imperial authority from a young age, as a youth Osric rallied a band of followers amongst the Vlandian vassal lords and led them west to the old imperial capital at Paravenos, seizing the governor's mansion in a bloodless coup and forcing the Calradian provincial administration to flee the city, never to return. Word of his deeds spread like wildfire amongst the other Vlandian clans, and soon after, he would amass in Paravenos a vast host, facing an imperial legion on the plains south of city. As the battle raged around him, Osric confronted a member of the Calradian Vaegir Guard in single combat. The fight lasted for an hour, and though blinded in one eye by the guardsman's dagger, Osric managed to grapple the man to the ground, beating him to death and earning the title of 'Iron-Arm'. Hailed king of an independent Vlandian kingdom at the mere age of 18, Osric now sets his one good eye outwards towards conquest.

{=EHiQI7ps}Regbold is the uncle of Osric Iron-Arm. When Osric's parents died in one of the Calradian Empire's many campaigns in the east, Regbold took in his young nephew and raised him as if he was his own son. Seeing the losses of his people in the empire's constant wars as completely unnecessary, Regbold was instrumental in moulding the young Osric into the future king of an independent Vlandia.

Oca is the warlord of clan dey Fortes, a highly militant clan who were among the first to join Osric Iron-Arm in his invasion of the western provinces of the Calradian Empire. In a great battle against the Battanians near the lake of Llyn Modris, Oca single-handedly slew two Battanian chieftains and routed their retinues, claiming the lands around the great lake for himself. A trustworthy friend and formidable oponent, his martial prowess is largely responsible for holding the northern frontier of the young Vlandian kingdom against its' many foes

Aetaric is the High King of the Battanians. A wise ruler, he has devoted his life to raising the status of his clan in Battanian society, choosing politics over bloodshed. A popular leader, though resented by the more warlike elements of Battanian society, his cautious approach has so-far paid off, allowing the Battanian clans to claim much territory from the crumbling Calradian Empire.

{=CzM6y3MT}The current ruling khan of the Iltanlar is Tulag of the Itakhar clan. A popular ruler, he is renowned for besting five imperial cataphracts in a single battle, earning the respect of the other clans as a formidable warrior. Understanding the virtues of strength in the violent nomadic culture of the Iltanlar, Tulag has been ruthless in pursuing enemies of the clans, bringing harsh justice to any who challenge his rule. However, he is constantly aware many lesser khans eye his position with greed, and so spends as much of his time fighting internal threats as he does external ones.

The current High Boyar of the Vaegirians is Vidar. Stoic and proud, he maintains a staunch defence of the senatorial privilege against those boyars who wish for a more dictatorial ruler. His close ties to the Calradian Empire, particularly to the Leonipardes; his wife's family, grant him a unique position in Calradian politics.

Lamenon was the first emperor of an independent Paraoian Empire, and claimed ancestry right back to the original founding colonists. He was a staunch defender of his people and a cunning political character, maneuvering deftly in the uncertain waters of Calradian politics. However, less than a year ago he was found dead in his chambers, and so his crown was passed to his eldest daughter, Lisara.

Lisara is the daughter of Lamenon, the first emperor of an independent Paraoian Empire. Thrust into the murky waters of Calradian politics at a young age due to her father's untimely death, she has been forced to learn the arts of state-craft quickly. Despite her age, she has nevertheless proved to be an effictive ruler, allowing many of her senators to run the empire's defence, whilst she looks to matters of state, justice and diplomacy.

Suterios is the patriarch of the Kavlonikos family, and serves as consul in the Paraoian senate. So named for the coastal colony which they rule, the Kavlonikos family are renowned across Calradia for their unmatched prowess in sailing, providing the Paraoians with the majority of manpower for their fleet.

Khomar is the eldest living descendent of the mythical god-khan Cizghun the Chosen, and so is hailed as divine ruler of the Cizygians. A merciless and cruel ruler, he has driven the tribes harshly onwards in a bloody march of conquest, destroying vast hosts of Iltanlar and Darshi to carve out a sizeable kingdom on Calradia's eastern steppes. Faced now with the borders of the Calradian Empire, he bides his time, waiting for the perfect time to use the civil unrest in the Empire to his advantage.

Erigai is the head of the Yanait; one of the most powerful tribes among the migrating Cizygians. A hardened warrior who lords over his tribe with an iron fist, he has proved an effective, if unpopular, leader in their migration into the west.

Lorgand is the current king of the Massa. A cunning strategist, it was he who came up with the plan to ambush the Empire's legions, thus assuring the independence of his people. However, such an act has alienated him from many of Calradia's more honorable rulers, with both the Empire and Vlandians viewing him as little more than a barbarian usurper. Now, he must fight to assure the survival of his nascent realm, fending off great pressure from his southern Vlandian neighbors.

Nariman is the current Shah of the Spahanfar Satrapy. A proven commander known for fighting at the head of his armies, he has led the Spahanfari to great victories over the Aserai and Calradian Empire, ensuring the protection of his foothold in the Nahasa. Though he recognizes the authority of the Padishah, he knows that to maintain his own power, he must be every bit the stalwart monarch.

The current High Chieftain of the Gotarnians is Thrasaric of the Aertus clan. It was he who led the Gotarnians in their conquest of the lands to the east of Lake Tanaesis, carving out a new territory with at least notional safety from the Calradian Empire's legions, then defeated the legions of Emperor Themestios in open battle. However, these wars were costly, and now Thrasaric finds his realm threatened from all sides by the nomads of the steppe, foresters to the north, and the ever-present hand of the Calradian Empire.

Khesrow is the current ruler of the Zarinzadeh family, speaking for the city state of Makeb and presiding over the noble council of the Tanash city states. Though not a ruler in his own right, Khesrow does maintain substantial sway over the decisions of the council, utilising his vast wealth to convince the other nobles of his cause. With the Calradian Empire in turmoil, he seeks others to fight his battles, advancing from the shadows a cause for Tanashi independence.
